before.enText: of a person or their face

data.enText: to become red, especially because you are embarrassed, angry or hot
She flushed with anger.
Sam felt her cheeks flush red.
when a toilet flushes or you flush it, water passes through it to clean it, after a handle, etc. has been pressed
to clean sth by causing water to pass through it
Flush the pipe out with clean water.
Flush clean water through the pipe.
to get rid of sth with a sudden flow of water

data.chText: 他们从马桶冲走了毒品。
data.enText: They flushed the drugs down the toilet.

data.chText: 大量饮水有助于清除体内毒素。
data.enText: Drinking lots of water will help to flush toxins out of the body.
flush sb/sth out (of sth)
flush sb/sth↔out

data.chText: 把（人或动物从藏身处）驱赶出来
data.enText: to force a person or an animal to leave the place where they are hiding
a red colour that appears on your face or body because you are embarrassed, excited or hot
A pink flush spread over his cheeks.

data.chText: 一阵强烈情感；（流露出的）一阵激情
data.enText: a sudden strong feeling; the hot feeling on your face or body caused by this

data.chText: 一阵愤怒 / 尴尬 / 热情 / 内疚
data.enText: a flush of anger/embarrassment/enthusiasm/guilt
the act of cleaning a toilet with a sudden flow of water
Give the toilet a flush.
a set of cards that a player has that are all of the same suit
(in) the first flush of sth

data.chText: （在）新鲜兴奋时刻，初期强盛阶段
data.enText: (at) a time when sth is new, exciting and strong

data.chText: 在青春活力旺盛时期；在热情高涨阶段；在热恋的初期
data.enText: in the first flush of youth/enthusiasm/romance

data.chText: 富有，很有钱（通常为短期的）
data.enText: having a lot of money, usually for a short time
completely level with each other

data.chText: 务必要使铺路石和草坪齐平。
data.enText: Make sure the paving stones are flush with the lawn.

simple_means.memory_skill: flu 流动 + sh → 奔流；冲洗

means: 富有，很有钱(通常为短期的)

ex.chText: 他听到表扬脸突然红了。

synonyms.bx: 指因内心害羞、惭愧、窘困等而脸红。

ex.chText: 那个女孩因发烧而脸通红。

synonyms.bx: 指因喜悦、生气、尴尬、发烧等而脸红。

data.enText: (in) the first flush of sth

data.chText: （在）新鲜兴奋时刻，初期强盛阶段
data.enText: (at) a time when sth is new, exciting and strong

data.chText: 在青春活力旺盛时期；在热情高涨阶段；在热恋的初期
data.enText: in the first flush of youth/enthusiasm/romance
flush sb/sth out (of sth)
flush sb/sth↔out

data.chText: 把（人或动物从藏身处）驱赶出来
data.enText: to force a person or an animal to leave the place where they are hiding

tr: sudden reddening of the face (as from embarrassment or guilt or shame or modesty)
a sudden rapid flow (as of water)
example: he heard the flush of a toilet
there was a little gush of blood
she attacked him with an outpouring of words

tr: the swift release of a store of affective force
example: they got a great bang out of it
he got a quick rush from injecting heroin

tr: a poker hand with all 5 cards in the same suit
a rosy color (especially in the cheeks) taken as a sign of good health
sudden brief sensation of heat (associated with menopause and some mental disorders)
the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
turn red, as if in embarrassment or shame
example: The girl blushed when a young man whistled as she walked by

tr: cause to flow or flood with or as if with water

example: The garbage flushed down the river

tr: irrigate with water from a sluice
rinse, clean, or empty with a liquid
glow or cause to glow with warm color or light
example: the sky flushed with rosy splendor

tr: having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value

example: hit him flush in the face
set it flush with the top of the table

value.def: If you flush, your face goes red because you are hot or ill, or because you are feeling a strong emotion such as embarrassment or anger.

example.ex: Do you sweat a lot or flush a lot?...
example.tran: 你常出汗或是脸上常发烫吗？

example.ex: He turned away embarrassed, his face flushing red.
example.tran: 他难为情地扭过头去，羞红了脸。

example.ex: There was a slight flush on his cheeks.
example.tran: 他脸上泛起一丝红晕。

example.ex: Her face was flushed with anger.
example.tran: 她气得满脸通红。

value.def: When someone flushes a toilet after using it, they fill the toilet bowl with water in order to clean it, usually by pressing a handle or pulling a chain. You can also say that a toilet flushes .

example.ex: She flushed the toilet and went back in the bedroom.
example.tran: 她冲完马桶回到卧室。

example.ex: ...the sound of the toilet flushing.
example.tran: 冲马桶的声音

example.ex: He heard the flush of a toilet.
example.tran: 他听见冲马桶的声音。

value.def: If you flush something down the toilet, you get rid of it by putting it into the toilet bowl and flushing the toilet.

example.ex: He was found trying to flush banknotes down the toilet.
example.tran: 他试图把钞票从马桶里冲走时被发现。

value.def: If you flush a part of your body, you clean it or make it healthier by using a large amount of liquid to get rid of dirt or harmful substances.

example.ex: Flush the eye with clean cold water for at least 15 minutes...
example.tran: 用干净冷水冲洗眼睛至少 15 分钟。

example.ex: Water is ideal to flush the kidneys and the urinary tract.
example.tran: 用水清洗肾脏和尿道最理想不过。

example.ex: ...an 'alternative' therapy that gently flushes out the colon to remove toxins.
example.tran: 一种温和冲洗结肠排出毒素的“替代”疗法

value.def: If you flush dirt or a harmful substance out of a place, you get rid of it by using a large amount of liquid.

example.ex: That won't flush out all the sewage, but it should unclog some stinking drains.
example.tran: 那样做虽不能将污物全部冲掉，但应该能疏通一些散发恶臭的排水管。

value.def: If you flush people or animals out of a place where they are hiding, you find or capture them by forcing them to come out of that place.

example.ex: They flushed them out of their hiding places...
example.tran: 他们把他们从藏身之处赶了出来。

example.ex: The Guyana Defence Force is engaged in flushing out illegal Brazilian miners operating in the country.
example.tran: 圭亚那国防军正采取行动驱逐在本国作业的非法巴西矿工。

value.tran: 把(人或动物)驱出;把…赶出

value.def: If one object or surface is flush with another, they are at the same height or distance from something else, so that they form a single smooth surface.

example.ex: Make sure the tile is flush with the surrounding tiles.
example.tran: 要保证每块瓷砖都和它周围的瓷砖在同一平面上。

value.def: If you are flush with money, you have a lot of it, usually only for a short time.

example.ex: At that time, many developing countries were flush with dollars earned from exports...
example.tran: 在那时，许多发展中国家都通过出口赚到了大量美元。

example.ex: If we're feeling flush we'll probably give them champagne.
example.tran: 等我们有钱了就可能会给他们喝香槟。

value.tran: (通常指短时间内)有钱的，富足的;暴富的

value.def: The flush of something is an intense feeling of excitement or pleasure that you have when you are experiencing it and for a short time afterwards.

example.ex: ...the first flush of young love.
example.tran: 年轻人初尝恋爱滋味的兴奋

example.ex: ...in the flush of victory.
example.tran: 在一阵胜利的喜悦中

value.tran: 一阵强烈感情;一阵兴奋(或快乐)

value.def: A flush of something is a large quantity of it that comes suddenly or quickly.

example.ex: ...the flush of recent victories.
example.tran: 最近接二连三的胜利

example.ex: ...a flush of memories.
example.tran: 记忆涌现

partsOfSpeech.dec: af 加强 + flu 流动 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 →〔钱多得〕不断流出 → 富裕的
con 共同 + flu 流动 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 流到一起 → 汇流的
ef 出 + flu 流动 + ent 表物 → 流出物
ef〔= e 出〕+ fluv〔= flu〕流动 + ial …的 → 流出〔不好的〕气味 → 恶臭的
flu 流动 + ency 表状态 → 流的状态 → 流畅
fluid 流动的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 流动性
flu 流动 + sh → 奔流；冲洗
in 进入 + flu 流动 + ence 表行为 → 流入 → 影响
in 进入 + flu 流动 + enza 病 → 流行病 → 流行感冒
in 进入 + flux 流动 → 流入 → 涌入
melli 蜂蜜 + flu 流动 + ous …的 → 流出蜂蜜 → 甜美的
re 回 + flu 流动 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 流回去 → 倒流的
super 过多 + flu 流动 + ous 有…性质的，关于…的 → 多流出来的 → 过剩的
